channel.title: Data Visualization on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Data Visualization on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Line plot for time series data
item.description: pre code, pre, code { white-space: pre !important; overflow-x: scroll !important; word-break: keep-all !important; word-wrap: initial !important; } Import data load(url('https://github.com/MingChen0919/gst-colloquium-workshop-2018/raw/master/content/datasets/datasets.RData')) Load libraries library(ggplot2) library(gridExtra) Visualization Feature against frame index Geom object: line frame_index -> x feature -> y # ggplot2 template p1 = ggplot(data = trajectory) + geom_line(mapping = aes(x = frame_index/1000, y = trajectory[, 2]), stat = "identity", position = "identity", color = '#ff6d6d') + coord_cartesian() + facet_null() + #----map data values to visual values--- scale_x_continuous(name = "Frame index") + scale_y_continuous(name = colnames(trajectory[2])) + theme_classic() p1 Distribution of feature values Geom object: density feature -> x # ggplot2 template p2 = ggplot(data = trajectory) + geom_density(mapping = aes(x = trajectory[, 2]), stat = "density", position = "identity", color = '#3dbfff') + coord_flip() + facet_null() + #----map data values to visual values--- scale_x_continuous(name = colnames(trajectory)[2]) + theme_classic() p2 Combine time series plot and density plot grid.

item.title: Scatterplot for PCA data
item.description: pre code, pre, code { white-space: pre !important; overflow-x: scroll !important; word-break: keep-all !important; word-wrap: initial !important; } Import data load(url('https://github.com/MingChen0919/gst-colloquium-workshop-2018/raw/master/content/datasets/datasets.RData')) Load libraries library(ggplot2) Visualization Collective Variables and Macrostates Geom object: point TIC0 -> x TIC1 -> y macrostate -> color ggplot(energy_tics) + geom_point(mapping = aes(x = TIC0, y = TIC1, color = as.factor(macrostate)), stat = "identity", position = "identity") + coord_cartesian() + facet_null() + #----map data values to visual values--- scale_x_continuous() + scale_y_continuous() + scale_color_identity() + theme() ggplot(energy_tics) + geom_point(mapping = aes(x = TIC0, y = TIC1, color = as.

Import and parse data library(tidyr) data_path <- '../datasets/john_datasets/traj_0.dat' feature_names = stringr::str_split(readLines(data_path)[1], '--')[[1]] # feature names have space and special characters. These characters are not good for variable names. # let's encode feature names names(feature_names) = paste0('V_', 1:length(feature_names)) data_raw = read.table(data_path, header = FALSE, sep = ' ', comment.char = 'D', stringsAsFactors = FALSE) colnames(data_raw) = names(feature_names) str(data_raw) ## 'data.frame': 5001 obs. of 29 variables: ## $ V_1 : num 0.

Import and parse data library(tidyr) library(ggplot2) ## Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 3.3.3 library(reshape2) ## ## Attaching package: 'reshape2' ## The following object is masked from 'package:tidyr': ## ## smiths data_path <- '../datasets/john_datasets/traj_0.dat' feature_names = stringr::str_split(readLines(data_path)[1], '--')[[1]] # feature names have space and special characters. These characters are not good for variable names. # let's encode feature names names(feature_names) = paste0('V_', 1:length(feature_names)) data_raw = read.table(data_path, header = FALSE, sep = ' ', comment.

item.title: Network Tutorial
